{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3546936,"name":"","username":"jacob_mazelin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jacob_mazelin/{size}/213574_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-04T03:43:12.825Z","cooked":"

Hello! We are using a Pigeon 2.0 with a CTRE Kraken drivetrain and our Pigeon’s gyro continuously increases during teleop and when the robot is not moving. We’ve pulled up the gyro value in this video. We’ve tried enabling each of the three Pigeon setting values (Enable Compass, Disable Motion, and Disable Temperature) but the drift seems to increase faster. We are using a brand new Pigeon and we have tried another Pigeon which gets drift too. We’re not sure what our issue is and would really appreciate some help before our competition this week. We thought that it could be a problem that the Pigeon is mounted near the radio and there could be some interference, but I think it’s something else. We’re using the SwerveDrive Generator CTRE code, so most of the Pigeon code is here. Thank you!

all gyros drift. how much drift are you talking about?

Normally, it drifts about 1-2 degrees every 10 seconds. When I disable the motion or temperature compensation in Phoenix Tuner X, it almost triples the speed, so 1 degrees every 3 seconds. The video is not sped up, this is abnormal drift. It’s enough drift so that when our robot is sitting there before the match starts, our autonomous routines are off, not allowing us to score and it gets worse in teleop

in my experience the drift from pigeon 2s is almost unnoticeable until like half an hour into driving, i wouldn’t expect for it to get particularly bad within a single match. its possible the hardware is faulty if your experiencing egregious drift. though I’m not an expert, this is just my experience, and I haven’t had any issues personally.

We experienced the same thing, we changed out our pigeon and it seemed to have fixed our problems. Before going through some drastic measures, did you actually calibrate your pigeon?

Yes, that was our first thought to fix the drift, but it still drifts. On our practice bot, we had the same problem with our other Pigeon, so we tried moving it to a different part of the robot which temporarily solved it, but the drift came back again

Having it with 2 of them sounds like an electrical issue to me.

  1. Are you giving it the right voltage?
  2. Is anything with really high emf nearby (like less than 2 inches)? That would be a large bundle of wire, a large cable, a motor, or a magnet.

After checking you’re using the right voltage, try moving it to a spot away from emf. If you have a multimeter it might be worth checking that the voltage your giving it is close to the right amount.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-03-04T15:05:15.836Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":148,"readers_count":147,"score":39.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494150,"topic_slug":"pigeon-2-0-drift","display_username":"Jeffrey Davis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62548,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pigeon-2-0-drift/494150/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3547226,"name":"","username":"jacob_mazelin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jacob_mazelin/{size}/213574_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-04T15:53:48.935Z","cooked":"

I believe our Pigeon is close (maybe 7 inches or so) to a Kraken. Would you recommend we move it further away? I think we’re using the 12V to power the Pigeon, but I’ll double check tonight if it’s near an emf

It is mounted flat. We recalibrated the Pigeon and the drift seemed to go away. I’m still not sure why it drifted so much when we calibrated it earlier though

isn’t that literally what “calibration” does? measure the drift and correct for it?
